articles.title: Watch Merrick Garland speak about the possibility of charging Donald Trump - CNN Video
articles.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland made his strongest comments yet about whether he'll charge former President Donald Trump saying that 'no person is above the law.' CNN's SE Cupp, John Avlon and Jeffrey Toobin discuss.

articles.title: Kinzinger shares preview of final January 6 hearing. Hear what Trump was doing for 187 minutes  - CNN Video
articles.description: Rep. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL) tweeted a preview clip ahead of the final January 6 hearing, showing former White House staffers discussing what President Trump was doing during the insurrection at the Capitol.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: Analysis: Here's proof that Donald Trump didn't get it on January 6
articles.description: Hours after rioters overran the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, then-President Donald Trump released a video message to them.
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.author: Analysis by Nathan Hodge, CNN
articles.title: The CIA chief says Putin is 'entirely too healthy.' What do we really know about his condition?
articles.description: CIA Director Bill Burns gave an unusually candid assessment this week, when he told attendees at the Aspen Institute's annual security confab that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "entirely too healthy."

articles.author: Whitney Wild and Jeremy Herb, CNN
articles.title: DHS IG tells Secret Service to stop investigating potentially missing texts
articles.description: The Department of Homeland Security inspector general has directed the Secret Service to stop its internal investigations into what happened to text messages related to January 6 that may have been deleted, according to a letter reviewed by CNN.

articles.author: Betsy Klein, Maegan Vazquez and Kate Sullivan, CNN
articles.title: Biden tests positive for Covid-19, White House says
articles.description: President Joe Biden has tested positive for Covid-19 and is experiencing "mild symptoms," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said Thursday.

articles.author: Ryan Nobles, Zachary Cohen, Annie Grayer and Jamie Gangel, CNN
articles.title: Trump had 'extreme difficulty' with his speech on the day after January 6
articles.description: The House committee investigating the insurrection plans to show footage at Thursday's hearing of then-President Donald Trump having difficulty working through efforts to tape a message to his supporters on January 7, 2021, the day after the Capitol riot, sou…

articles.title: Opinion: The January 6 hearing witness who should make Trump nervous
articles.description: Peter Bergen writes that former Trump administration deputy national security adviser Matthew Pottinger's upcoming testimony before the House select committee is expected to provide a climactic final summer public hearing.

articles.author: Jeremy Herb and Marshall Cohen, CNN
articles.title: What we know about Trump's inaction during the 187 minutes of January 6
articles.description: The House January 6 committee's final prime-time hearing Thursday is all about 187 minutes.

articles.author: Marshall Cohen and Hannah Rabinowitz, CNN
articles.title: Former Trump White House aide who met with January 6 panel attacks witnesses, lawmakers in profane and sexist rant
